examples.title: Example: California 23rd
examples.text: Nicknamed 'the district that disappears at high tide', this district was drawn to pack left-leaning costal cities into one district. It was redrawn in 2011.

examples.title: Example: Illinois 17th
examples.text: Nicknamed 'the rabbit on a skateboard'. This district was drawn up in bi-partisan effort to protect two imcumbents. It was redrawn in 2013.

examples.title: Example: North Carolina 12th
examples.text: This district was designed as a Minority-Majority district. That means this district was meant to hold as many minority voters as possible. It was redrawn in 2017.

examples.title: Example: The original
examples.text: This is the district that the term Gerrymander was coined from. Isn't it just...beautiful?

examples.title: Example: Illinois 4th
examples.text: Nicknamed 'earmuffs' because of its layout. It was created to pack two majority Hispanic parts of Chicago into one district.
